ResourceHeader.ResourceName: International Monitor for Auroral Geomagnetic Effects (IMAGE) Finnish Meterological Institute 1 min Ground Magnetometer Data
ResourceHeader.AlternateName: IMAGE FMI 60 s Ground Magnetometer Data
ResourceHeader.Description:
The International Monitor for Auroral Geomagnetic Effects (IMAGE) consists of 52 magnetometer stations maintained by 10 institutes from Finland, Germany, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, Denmark, and Iceland. The prime objectives of IMAGE are to study auroral electrojets and moving two-dimensional current systems. The long profile covering geographic latitudes from 51 to 82 degrees is especially favorable for electrojet studies. Together with other ground-based recordings (by radars, riometers, all-sky cameras) and satellite observations, IMAGE is an essential part in the investigations of high-latitude magnetospheric-ionospheric physics. Together with its predecessor, the EISCAT magnetometer cross started in 1982, IMAGE also provides high-quality data useful for studies of geomagnetic induction and long-term geomagnetic activity in the auroral region.
The Finnish Meterological Institute operates the following stations: ALT, KAU, KEV, MAS, KIL, IVA, MUO, PEL, RAN, OUJ, MEK, HAN, NUR, and TAR.

PublicationInfo.Authors: Juusola, L., Viljanen, A., Ryno, J. A., Gustafsson, J., and Kellinsalmi, M.

InformationURL.Name: International Monitor for Auroral Geomagnetic Effects (IMAGE) magnetometer data in WDC format.

AccessURL.Name: International Monitor for Auroral Geomagnetic Effects (IMAGE)

Parameter.Name: North Polar Distance
Parameter.Description: Observatory's North Polar distance. 0 to 180 degrees from the north geographic pole in thousandths of a degree. Decimal point is implied between positions 3 and 4.

Parameter.Name: Geographic Longitude
Parameter.Description: Observatory's Geographic longitude. 0 to 360 degrees measured east from Greenwich in thousandths of a degree. Decimal point is implied between positions 9 and 10.

Parameter.Name: Year
Parameter.Description: Year 2 characters

Parameter.Name: Month
Parameter.Description: Month 2 characters.

Parameter.Name: Day
Parameter.Description: Day 2 characters.

Parameter.Name: Components
Parameter.Description: Element (D,I,H,X,Y,Z, or F). 60 6-digit 1-minute values for the given element for that data hour. Each element value is given in a 6-digit field including a minus sign for negative values.

Parameter.Name: Hour
Parameter.Description: Hour of day (00-23).

Parameter.Name: Observatory
Parameter.Description: Observatory 3-letter code.

Parameter.Name: Arbitrary
Parameter.Description: Arbitrary.

Parameter.Name: Century
Parameter.Description: Century digit. Year = 2014, Century digit = 0. Year = 1889, Century digit = 8. Year = 1996, Century digit = 9 or 'SPACE' for backwards compatibility.

Parameter.Name: Preliminary or definitive data
Parameter.Description: Preliminary or Definitive data. Preliminary = P , Definitive = D.

Parameter.Name: Blanks
Parameter.Description: Blanks.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Component
Parameter.Description: 1st of 60 6-digit 1-minute values for the given element for that data hour. Each element value is given in a 6-digit field including a minus sign for negative values.
Parameter.Caveats: This component coordinate system strongly depends of the Components parameter. The first character from left is the sign, which is minus or, for positive values, space.
Parameter.Units: nT for the intensity elements and tenth-minutes for D and I.

Parameter.Name: Magnetic Field Component
Parameter.Description: 2nd of 60 6-digit 1-minute values for the given element for that data hour. Each element value is given in a 6-digit field including a minus sign for negative values.

Parameter.Name: Hourly Mean
Parameter.Description: Hourly Mean. The average of the preceeding 60 1-minute values. The hourly mean is given in a 6-digit field including a minus sign for negative values. Units: nT for the intensity elements and tenth-minutes for D and I.
Parameter.Caveats: This component strong depends of the Components parameter. The first character from left is the sign, which is minus or, for positive values, space.
Parameter.Units: nT for the intensity elements and tenth-minutes for D and I.
